title: South Korean won falls, but is off lows amid political chaos in country
content: South Korea's won on Tuesday cut losses after the country's parliament swiftly passed a resolution to demand the lifting of martial law.
summary: South Korea's won on Tuesday cut losses after the country's parliament swiftly passed a resolution to demand the lifting of martial law.

title: As global defense spending surges, South Korean arms makers look like a clear winner
content: A steady increase in global expenditure, combined with growing geopolitical uncertainties has provided South Korean arms makers with larger global markets.
summary: A steady increase in global expenditure, combined with growing geopolitical uncertainties has provided South Korean arms makers with larger global markets.

title: Salesforce shares rise after earnings beat on revenue, fourth-quarter guidance
content: Salesforce reported its fiscal third-quarter earnings on Tuesday and posted strong fourth-quarter guidance.
summary: Salesforce reported its fiscal third-quarter earnings on Tuesday and posted strong fourth-quarter guidance.

title: Okta shares pop 18% on earnings beat, strong guidance
content: Okta shares soared Tuesday after the company reported strong third-quarter results.
summary: Okta shares soared Tuesday after the company reported strong third-quarter results.

title: Microsoft faces £1 billion lawsuit in UK for allegedly overcharging rival cloud firms' customers
content: Microsoft was accused of unfairly overcharging customers of rival cloud companies including Amazon, Google and Alibaba Cloud in a U.K. lawsuit filed Tuesday.
summary: Microsoft was accused of unfairly overcharging customers of rival cloud companies including Amazon, Google and Alibaba Cloud in a U.K. lawsuit filed Tuesday.

title: Intel shares slide as Gelsinger exit leaves chipmaker without a 'quick fix'
content: Intel shares fell 6% on Tuesday, a day after the chipmaker announced the ouster of CEO Pat Gelsinger.
summary: Intel shares fell 6% on Tuesday, a day after the chipmaker announced the ouster of CEO Pat Gelsinger.

title: The top books and experiences for the wealthy this holiday season
content: J.P. Morgan Private Bank's "NextList2025" includes four museums, two wineries, four Broadway shows and 10 books.
summary: J.P. Morgan Private Bank's "NextList2025" includes four museums, two wineries, four Broadway shows and 10 books.

title: Visiting Europe's Christmas markets? Here's how to do it — via a river cruise
content: A river cruise is a convenient way to explore some of the oldest and most famous Christmas markets in Europe, writes contributor Penny Sadler.
summary: A river cruise is a convenient way to explore some of the oldest and most famous Christmas markets in Europe, writes contributor Penny Sadler.

title: OpenAI hires first marketing chief from Coinbase
content: OpenAI said on Tuesday that it's hired Kate Rouch from Coinbase as its first chief marketing officer.
summary: OpenAI said on Tuesday that it's hired Kate Rouch from Coinbase as its first chief marketing officer.

title: Apple says it uses Amazon's custom AI chips
content: Apple is currently using Amazon Web Services' custom AI chips for services like searching and will evaluate if its latest AI chip can be used to pre-train its AI models like Apple Intelligence.
summary: Apple is currently using Amazon Web Services' custom AI chips for services like searching and will evaluate if its latest AI chip can be used to pre-train its AI models like Apple Intelligence.

title: 'Realistic' green policies good for the U.S., Aramco CEO says, with Trump to return to White House
content: Trump has pledged to "end Biden's delays in federal drilling permits and leases that are needed to unleash American oil and natural gas production."
summary: Trump has pledged to "end Biden's delays in federal drilling permits and leases that are needed to unleash American oil and natural gas production."

title: China's AI balancing act — beating the U.S. but keeping the tech from threatening Beijing's rule
content: Prominent AI scientist Max Tegmark said the narrative of a geopolitical battle between the U.S. and China racing to build the smartest AI is a "suicide race."
summary: Prominent AI scientist Max Tegmark said the narrative of a geopolitical battle between the U.S. and China racing to build the smartest AI is a "suicide race."

title: Jaguar reveals 'Type 00' concept car, first under controversial new brand identity
content: Famed British carmaker Jaguar revealed its new vehicle design direction Monday night with the introduction of an all-electric concept car called "Type 00."
summary: Famed British carmaker Jaguar revealed its new vehicle design direction Monday night with the introduction of an all-electric concept car called "Type 00."

title: French lawmakers to hold no-confidence vote against embattled Barnier government on Wednesday
content: The motion will be debated at 4 p.m. on Wednesday, expected to be followed by a vote later in the evening.
summary: The motion will be debated at 4 p.m. on Wednesday, expected to be followed by a vote later in the evening.

title: BlackRock expanding in private credit, buys HPS Investment Partners for $12 billion
content: The deal, which is expected to close in mid-2025, comes during a boom for the private credit space.
summary: The deal, which is expected to close in mid-2025, comes during a boom for the private credit space.

title: Trump repeats vow to 'block' Nippon Steel's bid for U.S. Steel
content: While he made similar statements on the 2024 campaign trail, it was the first time that Trump had spoken about the deal since he won a second presidential term last month.
summary: While he made similar statements on the 2024 campaign trail, it was the first time that Trump had spoken about the deal since he won a second presidential term last month.

title: South Korea's inflation climbs in November, but misses expectations
content: Last week, the bank of Korea cut its headline inflation outlook for 2024 and 2025 to 2.3% and 1.9% respectively, down from 2.5% and 2.1%.
summary: Last week, the bank of Korea cut its headline inflation outlook for 2024 and 2025 to 2.3% and 1.9% respectively, down from 2.5% and 2.1%.

title: Art Cashin, New York Stock Exchange fixture for decades, dies at age 83
content: Art Cashin was UBS' director of floor operations at the NYSE and a man The Washington Post called "Wall Street's version of Walter Cronkite."
summary: Art Cashin was UBS' director of floor operations at the NYSE and a man The Washington Post called "Wall Street's version of Walter Cronkite."

title: Asian chip stocks mostly rise, shrugging off new U.S. semiconductor export curbs on China
content: Shares of major Asian chip stocks mostly rose on Tuesday, shrugging off the U.S. announcing new emiconductor export controls on China.
summary: Shares of major Asian chip stocks mostly rose on Tuesday, shrugging off the U.S. announcing new emiconductor export controls on China.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk loses bid to get $56 billion pay package reinstated
content: Elon Musk's pay package granted in 2018 was the largest compensation plan in U.S. history for a public company executive.
summary: Elon Musk's pay package granted in 2018 was the largest compensation plan in U.S. history for a public company executive.

title: Fed Governor Waller says he is 'leaning toward' a December rate cut, but worries about inflation
content: Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller cited recent data indicating that progress on inflation may be "stalling."
summary: Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller cited recent data indicating that progress on inflation may be "stalling."

title: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger ousted by board after disastrous performance
content: Intel announced Monday that CEO Pat Gelsinger has retired from the company, effective Dec. 1.
summary: Intel announced Monday that CEO Pat Gelsinger has retired from the company, effective Dec. 1.

title: GM to sell stake in battery cell plant to joint venture partner for roughly $1 billion
content: General Motors plans to sell its stake in a $2.6 billion electric vehicle battery cell plant in Michigan to its joint venture partner LG Energy Solution.
summary: General Motors plans to sell its stake in a $2.6 billion electric vehicle battery cell plant in Michigan to its joint venture partner LG Energy Solution.

title: Ireland's election delivers pro-business continuity despite voter discontent
content: The result shows Ireland is "still open to global companies, and as pro-business as it has been for the last 30 or 40 years."
summary: The result shows Ireland is "still open to global companies, and as pro-business as it has been for the last 30 or 40 years."

title: Trump's Defense pick, Pete Hegseth, faces new media report on alleged alcohol abuse, sexual impropriety
content: Former Fox News host Pete Hegseth, President-elect Donald Trump's pick for secretary of Defense, was investigated in 2017 for an alleged sexual assault.
summary: Former Fox News host Pete Hegseth, President-elect Donald Trump's pick for secretary of Defense, was investigated in 2017 for an alleged sexual assault.

title: Norway hits pause on controversial deep-sea mining plans
content: Norway has shelved plans to open a vast ocean area at the bottom of the Arctic for commercial-scale deep-sea mining.
summary: Norway has shelved plans to open a vast ocean area at the bottom of the Arctic for commercial-scale deep-sea mining.

title: Streamer Kai Cenat earns millions, breaks Twitch subscriber record during 30-day livestream
content: Kai Cenat, a 22-year-old live streamer, completed a so-called subathon on Saturday, streaming 24 hours a day for the entire 30 days of November.
summary: Kai Cenat, a 22-year-old live streamer, completed a so-called subathon on Saturday, streaming 24 hours a day for the entire 30 days of November.

title: Strikes underway at Volkswagen plants across Germany as wage conflict escalates
content: Volkswagen plants saw workers go on warning strikes on Monday as tensions over changes to labor agreements and potential factory closures escalated.
summary: Volkswagen plants saw workers go on warning strikes on Monday as tensions over changes to labor agreements and potential factory closures escalated.

title: Super Micro pops nearly 30% after special committee finds no 'evidence of misconduct'
content: Shares of Super Micro Computer surged more than 30% after a special committee ruled it found "no evidence of misconduct" at the embattled AI server maker.
summary: Shares of Super Micro Computer surged more than 30% after a special committee ruled it found "no evidence of misconduct" at the embattled AI server maker.

title: Chinese automakers BYD, Leapmotor and Xiaomi smash annual delivery targets ahead of schedule
content: The Chinese automakers have raced past their annual delivery targets a month ahead of schedule, underscoring their rapid growth and strong market demand.
summary: The Chinese automakers have raced past their annual delivery targets a month ahead of schedule, underscoring their rapid growth and strong market demand.
